storyTitle: As Integration Engineer, I want to implement detailed logging of all API data transfers to achieve traceability

testCases.title: Validate logging of API requests and responses
preconditions: API gateway and backend services are running
Logging system is enabled and configured
User has valid credentials for API access
Log storage has sufficient capacity
Support Engineer has access to log search UI

steps.action: Authenticate to the API system with valid credentials
steps.expectedResult: Authentication is successful and user session is established

steps.action: Perform multiple API data transfer operations including GET, POST, PUT, and DELETE requests
steps.expectedResult: All API operations complete successfully and return appropriate status codes

steps.action: Verify that all requests and responses are logged with complete details including payload, timestamp, user identity, endpoint, method, and status code
steps.expectedResult: All requests and responses are logged with complete details including timestamps, user identities, request/response payloads, HTTP methods, endpoints, and response codes

steps.action: Navigate to the log search UI interface
steps.expectedResult: Log search UI loads successfully and displays search and filter options

steps.action: Search for logs using various criteria such as timestamp range, user identity, endpoint, and HTTP method
steps.expectedResult: Logs are searchable and filterable by all specified criteria, returning accurate results matching the search parameters

steps.action: Select specific logs from the search results and choose export option
steps.expectedResult: Export dialog appears with format options (JSON, CSV, XML)

steps.action: Select desired export format and confirm export action
steps.expectedResult: Logs are exported successfully in the chosen format with all data intact and downloadable

postconditions: All API data transfers are logged in the system
Logs are accessible via search UI
Exported log file is available for download
No data loss or corruption in logged information

testCases.title: Test secure storage and access control of logs
preconditions: Logging system is operational
Log storage is configured with encryption
Access control policies are defined
Test user accounts with different permission levels exist
Audit logging is enabled for access attempts

steps.action: Attempt to access log storage or log search UI using unauthorized credentials or without authentication
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied with appropriate error message (401 Unauthorized or 403 Forbidden)

steps.action: Verify that the unauthorized access attempt is logged in the audit trail
steps.expectedResult: Unauthorized access attempt is logged with timestamp, attempted user identity, and access denial reason

steps.action: Authenticate with authorized Support Engineer credentials that have log access permissions
steps.expectedResult: Authentication is successful and user is granted access to log system

steps.action: Access logs via the search UI and verify full visibility of log entries
steps.expectedResult: Access is granted with full log visibility, all log entries are displayed and accessible based on user permissions

steps.action: Navigate to log storage location and inspect stored log files
steps.expectedResult: Log files are present in storage location

steps.action: Verify encryption of stored logs by checking file properties, encryption headers, or attempting to read raw log files
steps.expectedResult: Logs are encrypted at rest, raw files are unreadable without decryption keys, encryption algorithm and status are confirmed

steps.action: Verify that encryption keys are stored securely and separately from log data
steps.expectedResult: Encryption keys are stored in secure key management system, separate from log storage

postconditions: Unauthorized access attempts are blocked and logged
Authorized users can access logs appropriately
Log encryption is verified and active
Security audit trail is maintained

testCases.title: Measure logging overhead on API performance
preconditions: API system is running in stable state
Performance monitoring tools are configured
Baseline performance metrics are available
Test environment mirrors production load
Logging system can be toggled on/off for testing

steps.action: Disable logging functionality in the API system
steps.expectedResult: Logging is successfully disabled and confirmed inactive

steps.action: Execute a series of API requests (minimum 1000 requests) covering various endpoints and measure average latency, throughput, and response times
steps.expectedResult: Baseline latency is recorded with metrics including average response time, p95, p99 latency, and throughput

steps.action: Document baseline performance metrics for comparison
steps.expectedResult: Baseline metrics are documented including average latency, min/max latency, and requests per second

steps.action: Enable comprehensive logging functionality with all features active
steps.expectedResult: Logging is successfully enabled and confirmed active for all API operations

steps.action: Execute the same series of API requests (minimum 1000 requests) with identical parameters and measure average latency, throughput, and response times
steps.expectedResult: Performance metrics with logging enabled are recorded including average response time, p95, p99 latency, and throughput

steps.action: Calculate the percentage increase in latency by comparing baseline metrics with logging-enabled metrics
steps.expectedResult: Latency increase is calculated and is under 3% compared to baseline performance

steps.action: Analyze performance logs and system resource utilization (CPU, memory, I/O) during both test runs
steps.expectedResult: No significant degradation detected, resource utilization increase is minimal, and system remains stable under logging load

steps.action: Review logging throughput and verify no log entries are dropped or delayed
steps.expectedResult: All API operations are logged without loss, logging keeps pace with API request rate

postconditions: Baseline and logging-enabled performance metrics are documented
Performance impact is quantified and within acceptable limits
Logging overhead is confirmed to be under 3%
System performance is restored to normal state

storyTitle: As Support Engineer, I want to receive alerts on critical API integration failures to achieve timely issue resolution

testCases.title: Validate alert triggering on critical API failures
preconditions: API monitoring system is active and configured
Alert thresholds for critical failures are defined
Email and SMS notification channels are configured
Test recipient contact information is set up
Alert UI is accessible to Support Engineers
System can simulate API failure scenarios

steps.action: Configure alert recipients to include test email address and SMS number
steps.expectedResult: Alert recipients are successfully configured and saved in the system

steps.action: Simulate a critical API failure event such as service unavailability, timeout threshold breach, or error rate exceeding critical threshold
steps.expectedResult: Critical API failure event is generated in the system

steps.action: Monitor the alerting system for failure detection
steps.expectedResult: System detects the failure within monitoring interval and triggers alert generation

steps.action: Check configured email inbox for alert notification
steps.expectedResult: Alert email is received by configured recipients within 1 minute containing failure details, timestamp, affected API, and severity level

steps.action: Check configured mobile device for SMS alert notification
steps.expectedResult: Alert SMS is received by configured recipients within 1 minute containing critical failure summary and reference ID

steps.action: Verify alert content includes all required information: failure type, timestamp, affected service, severity, and incident ID
steps.expectedResult: All required alert information is present and accurate in both email and SMS notifications

steps.action: Navigate to the alert UI and locate the triggered alert
steps.expectedResult: Alert is visible in the UI with status 'Unacknowledged' and all failure details displayed

steps.action: Click acknowledge button for the alert in the UI
steps.expectedResult: Alert acknowledgement is processed, status changes to 'Acknowledged', acknowledgement timestamp and user are recorded

steps.action: Verify acknowledgement is logged and visible in alert history
steps.expectedResult: Acknowledgement is logged with timestamp, acknowledging user identity, and is visible in alert history and audit trail

postconditions: Alert is triggered and delivered successfully
Alert is acknowledged and logged
Alert history is updated
Notification channels are confirmed functional

testCases.title: Test alert configuration and escalation
preconditions: Alerting system is operational
Multiple user accounts with different roles exist
Escalation policies can be configured
Alert configuration UI is accessible
Test notification channels are available

steps.action: Navigate to alert configuration interface via /alerts/configure endpoint
steps.expectedResult: Alert configuration page loads successfully with options for recipients, channels, and escalation rules

steps.action: Configure primary alert recipients including email addresses and phone numbers for initial notification
steps.expectedResult: Primary recipients are added and saved successfully

steps.action: Configure escalation rules including escalation timeout (e.g., 10 minutes without acknowledgement) and secondary recipients
steps.expectedResult: Escalation rules are configured with timeout period and secondary recipient list

steps.action: Save alert configuration and verify settings are persisted
steps.expectedResult: Settings are saved successfully and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Verify saved configuration by reviewing settings in the UI
steps.expectedResult: All configured recipients and escalation rules are displayed correctly and match entered values

steps.action: Trigger a critical alert event using simulated API failure
steps.expectedResult: Alert is triggered and sent to primary recipients

steps.action: Do not acknowledge the alert and wait for the configured escalation timeout period to elapse
steps.expectedResult: Escalation timeout period elapses without acknowledgement

steps.action: Monitor for escalation alert delivery to secondary recipients
steps.expectedResult: Alert is escalated as per policy, secondary recipients receive escalation notification with increased urgency indicator

steps.action: Navigate to /alerts/history endpoint to review alert history
steps.expectedResult: Alert history page loads showing all alert events

steps.action: Locate the triggered alert and review escalation logs
steps.expectedResult: All events are recorded accurately including initial alert, escalation trigger, escalation notifications, timestamps, and recipient information

postconditions: Alert configuration is saved and active
Escalation policy is verified functional
Alert history contains complete event trail
All notifications are delivered per configuration

testCases.title: Verify integration with incident management tools
preconditions: External incident management system is accessible
API credentials for incident management system are available
Integration configuration interface is available
Network connectivity between systems is established
Test incident management workspace is set up

steps.action: Navigate to integration configuration settings in the alerting system
steps.expectedResult: Integration configuration page loads with options for external system connections

steps.action: Select incident management system from available integrations and enter connection details including API endpoint, authentication credentials, and workspace/project identifier
steps.expectedResult: Integration form accepts all required configuration parameters

steps.action: Test connection to incident management system using provided credentials
steps.expectedResult: Connection test is successful, confirmation message indicates integration is active and authenticated

steps.action: Save integration configuration and enable automatic incident creation for critical alerts
steps.expectedResult: Integration configuration is saved, automatic incident creation is enabled and confirmed active

steps.action: Trigger a critical alert event by simulating API failure
steps.expectedResult: Critical alert is generated in the alerting system

steps.action: Monitor incident management system for automatic incident creation
steps.expectedResult: Incident is created automatically in the external incident management system within 1 minute of alert trigger

steps.action: Open the created incident in the incident management system
steps.expectedResult: Incident is accessible and opens successfully

steps.action: Verify incident details including title, description, severity, timestamp, affected service, and alert reference ID
steps.expectedResult: Incident reflects alert information correctly with all details accurately transferred including failure type, timestamp, severity level, affected API endpoint, and link back to original alert

steps.action: Verify incident status matches alert status and updates are synchronized
steps.expectedResult: Incident status is synchronized with alert status, any updates in either system are reflected appropriately

postconditions: Integration with incident management system is active
Incident is created and contains accurate information
Bidirectional synchronization is verified
Integration is ready for production use
